meanings.definition: Characterized by or involving earnest and kindly protest or remonstrance.
meanings.sent1: Her expostulatory tone conveyed her sincere disagreement with the decision.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's expostulatory remarks aimed to guide the students towards better behavior.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave an expostulatory meow when it saw its empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The expostulatory letter from the employee highlighted the unfair treatment at work.
meanings.sent5: The expostulatory expression on his face showed his disapproval clearly.

meanings.definition: Serving to express earnest protest or remonstrance.
meanings.sent1: The poster had an expostulatory message urging people to take action.
meanings.sent2: Her expostulatory gestures emphasized her dissatisfaction with the decision.
meanings.sent3: The expostulatory sign outside the store caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: His expostulatory tone in the meeting made his concerns known to all.
meanings.sent5: The expostulatory tone of the music conveyed a sense of urgency.

meanings.sent1: The student's expostulatory speech at the assembly impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The expostulatory letter to the editor highlighted the community's concerns.
meanings.sent3: The expostulatory protest outside City Hall drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her expostulatory response to the criticism showed her determination.
meanings.sent5: The expostulatory conversation with the manager led to positive changes.
